etymology.description: Pictogram: a stretched animal hide—top as head, bottom as tail and legs; hand-like 臼 elements were briefly added historically.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an animal skin stretched for tanning, with head and limbs indicated, which naturally yields the sense of hide/leather. By extension it came to signify transforming or stripping away the old, leading to meanings like change and reform. Later scribal forms simplified away the added hand-like elements.

examples.chinese: 这件夹克是用真皮革做的(這件夾克是用真皮革做的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn jiákè shì yòng zhēn pígé zuò de.
examples.english: This jacket is made of genuine leather.

examples.chinese: 政府推行全面改革(政府推行全面改革)，社会发生了深刻的变化(社會發生了深刻的變化)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ tuīxíng quánmiàn gǎigé, shèhuì fāshēng le shēnkè de biànhuà.
examples.english: The government implemented comprehensive reforms, and society underwent profound changes.

examples.chinese: 公司通过技术革新提高了效率(公司通過技術革新提高了效率)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī tōngguò jìshù géxīn tígāo le xiàolǜ.
examples.english: The company improved efficiency through technological innovation.
